children.subject: +1 what BS is this
+1 this should be a meme
+1 ucbmfet has spoken
lol

Are you serious?

This is one of the WORST ideas I've heard. Why would people trust you with grades and banking information?

Not to mention "it won't take more than 24 hours"? Wait till you start...

+1 if you agree.

history.content:
Piazza certainly has its faults: the UI is ugly, the Android app is unreliable, and (from what I hear) the devs there aren't too keen on responding to user feedback. They seem to be focusing heavily on Piazza Careers (for obvious reasons). There's a lot they could improve on.

But, to be blunt, you're seriously underestimating the amount of engineering effort required to make a scalable, secure, reliable Piazza clone. It's easy to say, "Sure, I'll just make a quick Django/Flask/Rails app and throw it on an S3-backed EC2 instance," but no instructor would take their chances with a dark horse platform with a single developer when there's an established, venture-backed, familiar, free alternative that has been battle-tested and vetted over the course of many semesters.

If you want to build this for practice, by all means do it. But keep your expectations low.

It's easy to say, "Sure, I'll just make a quick Django/Flask/Rails app and throw it on an S3-backed EC2 instance," but no instructor would take their chances with a dark horse platform with a single developer when there's an established, venture-backed, familiar, free alternative that has been battle-tested and vetted over the course of many semesters.

If you want to build this for practice, by all means do it. But keep your expectations low.

children.subject: Student responder here. I think your goals are admirable. I'm serious - I myself have thought of building a better Piazza clone. But I do think your immediate goals are a tad unrealistic. But I mean, don't let me (and the other people in this thread) discourage you. When Dropbox was first released, plenty of people were like, "Why would I use this when I can just use a USB?" (Google for the HN thread on this; you can read it for yourself.)
(Then again, they had a fully working beta already.)

Hi Anon,

The finished product (not some beta) will be finished within 24 hours.

Student responder:

I'm NOT doing this for practice! I want to build piazza's replacement. Piazza has so many flaws and it's time someone builds something better.

People also laughed at Zuckerburg and Larry Page before they built Fortune 100 companies.

Look where they are now. 

You're basically guaranteeing my success.

Hi everyone,

I am the OP and am NOT the Anon above (Zuckerberg and Page reply).

He is trolling us.
Oh man, the real OP should've included some proof-of-identity hashes in his post. Piazza needs to implement those generated profile pictures that Yik Yak had.
OP here. I will certainly build this. Thanks for the idea!
OP Here. Building this feature has taken me two hours so far. I will therefore have to abandon it. We are hiring though and I encourage you to apply while you have time over break.
Considering your anonymity, how do you expect anyone to know where to apply? How do you even plan to make it worthwhile to others?
OP here, stop laughing at me and saying it's impossible, I'll show all you
You are hiring? How do we apply?
OP here. Reply with your email address and we will reach out to you.
hilfinger@cs.berkeley.edu

OP Here. I have emailed the email address (seriously guys, I'm not kidding here, I wanted to see what Hilfinger would say). Prof. Hilfinger replied with a very angry email telling me not to waste his time.
^Can we see the email?
top kek
lol
Why? I trust my coding abilities.
Why's that? Serious, non-sarcastic question. Do you have extraordinary credentials or something?

OP here. No, I don't have extraordinary credentials. But as Professor Hug said, don't place too much trust in authority. You can build it YOURSELF. It is with this mindset that I say, yes, I can implement TLS myself. I believe in myself.
Well that's... good. I mean, too much confidence is a bad thing too, but hey you have a good attitude. Best of luck to you!

Thank you Anon and Mia! We are currently hiring. We can provide you with stock shares until we get VC funding. 

We are looking for people to add Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, and Heuristics to the platform. Please reply if you have one of these skills.

Why would VCs give you money, especially considering the legal issues that would be inherent in "copy-pasting" gradescopes code? It's open source but that doesn't mean you can use it in the way you're describing. So far, a combination gradescope piazza doesn't sound worth investing in.
OP here, I actually am doing cutting-edge research in ML/AI/deep learning/heuristics, don't need any of you plebs

OP here. Actually, I would still like people to apply. I'm saying this for your sake, not mine. I'll feel bad if Piazza 2.0 becomes a multi billion dollar company and I didn't give anyone else the chance to join.

Terrific question. I am not going to replace gradescope. I am going to copy gradescope's code, which is open source, into piazza 2.0. That way, students can visit one site for all their academic needs.
Wait, Gradescope is open source?

Yes.

https://github.com/gradescope
Open source does not mean free to copy at will.

That's exactly what it means.

"Open-source software (OSS) is computer software with its source code made available with a license in which the copyright holder provides the rights to study, change, and distribute the software to anyone and for any purpose"

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open-source_software
Not all licenses permit commercial use.
Anon, I will act first and apologize later. Just how Zuckerberg built Facebook and dealt with Saverin and Winklevoss's later.

That's incredibly flawed. Any site that's a product is not licensed for commercial use, that can be easily assumed. Have you even looked at their github? The majority of code there is for interacting with their site-- you can't  clone it based on simply copying it. At best you could hook into their service.

I am more concerned with making the world a better place and earning billions of dollars than some pesky legal code. Just how Bill Gates was sued for antitrust violations, President Trump was sued for Trump University, the people who do good get targeted.
I'll entertain you: you say "(no need for gradescope)". How exactly are you going to replace the grading software that is gradescope? How will your software be better? How will grading exams work?
What do you mean. Please explain Anon.
This is a canonically bad idea
Can't wait until it actually gets built tomorrow and we get to find out who he or she is
We could just be getting trolled lmao
Starting to think that too...
obviously satire...
Yeah but you know it's still 2016 who knows what might happen

OP Here.

Rereading my question, I see how it can be interpreted as satire. However, it's not. I am a freshman and a hustler. I want to be the next tech billionare. And this is how tech billionares start, by creating software everyone dismisses as useless or impossible to build.

Are there some features that seem hypocritical or ridiculous like TLS or no anonymity? Absolutely. I'm building them for the best of the platform though.
but did tech billionaires announce that they will be tech billionaires by doing a specific project?
OP Here. Tech billionares do whatever they want. I have adopted that mentality because I will one day be one.
OP here. By "one day", I mean literally one day from now. I'm expecting to go public day after tomorrow
Do you mean release Piazza 2.0 or have your IPO?
OP here. Piazza 2.0 comes out at 4:20 am tomorrow, and the IPO will be Saturday. They're gonna open the NYSE just for me.

omg im so happy for you op. I can tell youre gonna be a greeeeeeeeeeat success if you managed to get obama to open the nyse just for you1!!123!

wish you the best of luck. show all these h8ers that u r the mann.

lookin forward to buying your stock ;))

> Anonymity is removed
> posts anonymously
lol
Hi Anons, I am not joking here. I've noticed some serious security vulnerabilities in TLS that I will patch. I don't want to endanger my customers.
Wauu til that TLS is a payment channel
OP here. Richard what do you mean?

Pay people directly from piazza using my custom TLS implementation.

lmao

This was entertaining anon thanks

I'm still stuck on the "I'll keep it cheap" bit. Why would anyone switch to a service that they have to pay for when they have perfectly acceptable, vetted, tested, and backed alternatives? How is anything you build in 24 hours going to be so amazing that everyone will want to switch? I'm not saying I don't think you can't do it in 24 hours, but I am saying I don't think you can make something that looks better than piazza (versus like it came out of a hackathon) in that amount of time. And why would anyone want a combination of piazza and gradescope? At that point it's bcourses.

I blame hackathon culture for propagating the myth that good software is written over the course of a weekend on four hours of sleep by haphazardly gluing together APIs. (React and Bootstrap, anyone?) 

Okay, that was too harsh. Hackathons can be a lot of fun, and they're great learning experiences. But I hope people don't think Google was made in a day.

OP Here.

Anon 1: I assure you, I will test and vet my service. In fact, I will knock on a couple doors in Palo Alto when I have time and get some VC money. Also, I don't want to build bcourses, I want to build piazza with bcourses and gradescope integrated inside. That way, you only need one site for all your Berkeley needs.

Anon 2: Google wasn't built in a day. But Facebook, which started as FaceMash, was. Snapchat, Quora, Dropbox, and EECS are all the products of hackathons.
OP Here. I am not paying people. Students can pay other classmates (as well as Professors and TAs) using Piazza. It's easier than searching them on Venmo.
Why would you pay professors and TAs? That could get you in serious trouble with the university. And one site for everything is CalCentral.

I'm not OP. Just because you CAN pay TAs doesn't mean you should. However, in a few cases, it can be extremely helpful. For example, let's say you borrow something from a TA. Or if the Professor buys you food. Then it can be really helpful.
Why the f** would a professor like Sahai, Walrand, Hilfinger, Hug, etc buy you food?
OP here. It's because I'm just that impressive - all the professors want to network with me.

your features are questionable:

- why remove anonymity? you yourself are anonymous

- question quotas? how does this remove dumb questions?

- notes that bypass notification settings are extremely useful for making sure students receive important information while allowing the to not get spammed by all the questions posted

- if you've ever been a TA or a reader for a CS class, then you know how extremely useful gradescope is and how much work it would take to build something like it.

- why are you paying people?
Hi Kuriakose, what do you mean?

OP Here. Unfortunately, we still need to add Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Heuristics, and Computer Vision to the platform. Please apply if you have taken CS 188, 189 or can code a Heuristic data structure.

A) you said the finished product would be available in 24 hours-- you're already failing to live up to your claims. Especially as you appear to be answering messages in piazza instead of actually working. Nice troll. 

B) why the hell do you need computer vision in "piazza 2.0"
Computer Vision is an integral aspect of Piazza 2.0. We use Computer Vision to scan graded exams and match each question with the rubric item.
OP here. for fucks sake I don't actually need 24 hours, I can finish in 12. I'm just blowing off steam here.
that is not what computer vision is.
OP here. shut up you plebeian, piazza 2.0 won't need exams to be scanned. You just wave exams in front of a webcam and it works.
Is this going to be available in 24 hours? Where can we see this?
OP here, I claim full responsibility for all the "OP here" posts. After all, I am the OP.
same
I am so sure this is just an extremely simple troll. A bunch of anons masquerading as OP. Anyone can edit the OP as well. Is this piazza site even meant for such discussions?
OP here, this illustrates precisely why anon will not be a feature in piazza 2.0
This actually makes a lot of sense.

To the OP: Why are you Anon?

More importantly, if one of the key features of your service is the removal of the anonymity option, why are you being Anon right now?
No. You are not a CS God.
OP here. No, go collect your unemployment checks. Non-gods need not apply
OP here, we don't accept people who are not EECS master-aces like I am, please git gud

"Anybody who has earned A+ grades in at least 5 upper-div cs courses is welcome to apply"

Unfortunately, I only have A+'s in 2 upper-divs, and have 2 A's, and 1 A-. Can I still apply?
OP here. This is most definitely not a joke. Get ready to have your mind blown tomorrow.

Hi Anon, I am the OP (for real). I did NOT mean for this to be a troll. I am serious about re-building Piazza and using it to secure internships. I am working on building Piazza 2.0. However, I have run into some issues but I'll try my best to finish it by tomorrow.

Lol this has turned into one giant troll. If this is an actual thing, I expect a link to be posted by tomorrow evening for it. If not I am going to assume this isn't hysterical joke that has been providing me amusement for quite some time now. Thanks for that!
+1 I have the same exact problem, OP please consider

OP Here. We would need to develop mind reading technology for that. That requires CS Gods to join the company. If they can build mind reading technology, I will sell it to Google for a few hundred million and then consider your feature.

I think this is a great idea. One request:

Speaking from experience, one of my biggest gripes with the Piazza platform is that "Piazza" sounds a great deal like "Pizza."

"What's the matter with that?" one might ask. 
The issue is that I have a rather short attention span. Oftentimes, a few minutes after logging onto Piazza, I forget why I'm there, and get distracted by the fact that the name "Piazza" sounds a lot like "Pizza."
This usually results in me thinking about pizza and getting hungry! 

I would like Piazza 2.0 to have an AI that is capable of detecting when a user is distracted and is thinking about pizza. It can then provide some quick, helpful links to nearby pizza places (delivery preferable). Perhaps this can be integrated with Grubhub (although I am aware that Grubhub has its fair share of issues as well, so perhaps a good followup project would be to create Grubhub 2.0; it shouldn't take much more than a couple hours, given your skill).
OP here. We already have contacted them and are trying to see if they, along with other instructors, are willing to work together with us.
Will an instructor (Lily or Nicole) guide us? This is what CS advisors are for

OP here. Being unable to identify the real OP from the trolls is exactly why this thread has been overrun by memers and skeptics.

This is actually my first time revisiting the post since I initially made it. I am hard at work and have been successful at embedding gradescope inside Piazza. I am almost finished with the anonymity features (I just need to always set the anonymity boolean to True; I learned this in my graduate algorithms course) and will have payment features up in no time by requiring users to link facebook to Piazza and using Facebook's payment system, only with extra TLS for security. 

Trust me, this will be up by tomorrow. I have heard your concerns; the only valid one is the Piazza/Pizza problem. I will solve this by renaming my website Berger, after my favorite 20th century German mathematician. Stay tuned.
nice try OP

The REAL OP here... this is obviously fake. I will release code from my github tomorrow. I have been working extremely hard for the past few hours so I can get a beta out to the public tomorrow, and will post again here in this piazza when I am ready
ATTENTION: PIAZZA 2.0 WILL BE POSTED ON MY GITHUB SOON: https://github.com/kmishra9
OP here again. I just wanted to show you my progress and what I have so far. Check it out: https://biazza.com/class/test1
please don't turn shitposting into a thing on this piazza :(
what's shitposting?

This is just from my perspective, and I would like to address your question since you seem to be serious.

But OP, you appear to be pretty arrogant in most of what you've said so far. Rebuilding Piazza, copying Gradescope, adding all of the machine learning/AI/Computer Vision buzzwords, asking for "CS Gods" to work for you, and assuming it can be done overnight as if it's as simple as writing a simple 1 + 1 = 2 is, well, pretty annoying to hear. If you're the ambitious freshman you say you are (who probably has a lot of experience based on how you present yourself), I can understand why this appears to be a trivial but beneficial product; however you've also been dismissing the advice and words of others, citing previous examples of "tech billionaires" as if you can copy their success just by making something that's supposedly going to be worth a lot of money. Additionally, I don't believe you've posted links to your GitHub/beta version so far either, so this all still appears like a giant troll. Even I'm not sure if you're being serious about all of this (and I remain skeptical if you are).

tl;dr: it's a mixture of your attitude, what you're attempting to do, and how you're trying to do it.
In the real OPs defense, a lot of the polish (i.e. ml/ai, cs gods) was added by anons such as myself
I guess that goes to show OP's point with problems of anonymity I guess XD which also saddens me a little bit that people are abusing it in a way.
ATTENTION: PIAZZA 2.0 WILL BE POSTED ON MY GITHUB SOON: https://github.com/kmishra9

Why is "Re-implementing piazza" a meme?

I am the OP behind @2944. Overnight, the post turned into a meme. People thought it was really funny I wanted to rebuild piazza for some reason.

One person said "this is one of the WORST ideas of all time", someone else said "get off your high horse bro."

Can someone explain to me what's so funny? Why is it a joke? I don't get it.
THE LORD HAS SPOKEN
this oughta be good
what if this is a troll post
what do you mean
person who is not OP posted said person's github link
ATTENTION: PIAZZA 2.0 WILL BE POSTED ON MY GITHUB SOON: https://github.com/kmishra9
Kunal let me know when you get the internship!
I don't think tech companies hire arrogant trolls.
Btw not me. Peace, people
Kunal this is clearly your github. Please don't play dumb now, just post the code. We all want to see the new piazza.
rip kunal
WTF is Kunal doing, is he playing games with us? Maybe he got stage fright because he doesn't think the website is good enough.
Yeah I was thinking the exact same thing...
ATTENTION: PIAZZA 2.0 WILL BE POSTED ON MY GITHUB SOON: https://github.com/kmishra9
k den
bamboozled again!
U got trolled

history.content:
I am re-building piazza from scratch. The project is trivial and it won't take longer than 24 hours. Afterwards, I'll convince all the professors to adopt my software. These connections will guarantee me an internship at Facebook or Google.

Please give me feedback and feature requests.

ATTENTION: PIAZZA 2.0 WILL BE POSTED ON MY GITHUB SOON: https://github.com/kmishra9

Features
- Anonymity is removed
- Question quotas (prevent dumb questions)
- Run code on piazza 
- No annoying "notes" that bypass notification settings
- Professors upload grades onto our server (no need for gradescope)

- All posted code is plagariasm checked, reports sent to professor

- Pay people directly from piazza using my custom TLS implementation

Also, should I make piazza free or paid? Thoughts on freemium model? I'll keep it cheap but developers ought to be compensated for their time.

OP here, I would like to hire people for my startup Piazza 2.0. I'm funded by Google Ventures, and I need all the help I can get. Anybody who has earned A+ grades in at least 5 upper-div cs courses is welcome to apply
history.subject: [FEEDBACK] Re-implementing piazza

history.subject: [FEEDBACK] Re-implementing piazza

history.content:
I am re-building piazza from scratch. The project is trivial and it won't take longer than 24 hours. Afterwards, I'll convince all the professors to adopt my software. These connections will guarantee me an internship at Facebook or Google.

Please give me feedback and feature requests.

ATTENTION: PIAZZA 2.0 WILL BE POSTED ON MY GITHUB SOON: https://github.com/kmishra9

Features
- Anonymity is removed
- Question quotas (prevent dumb questions)
- Run code on piazza 
- No annoying "notes" that bypass notification settings
- Professors upload grades onto our server (no need for gradescope)

- All posted code is plagariasm checked, reports sent to professor

- Pay people directly from piazza using my custom TLS implementation

Also, should I make piazza free or paid? Thoughts on freemium model? I'll keep it cheap but developers ought to be compensated for their time.

history.subject: [FEEDBACK] Re-implementing piazza

history.content:
I am re-building the pizza from scratch. The project is trivial and it won't take longer than 24 hours. Afterwards, I'll convince all the professors to adopt my software. These connections will guarantee me an internship at Facebook or Google. I will prove to everyone that I am an EECS master-ace, and that I am better than everyone else.

Please give me feedback and feature requests.

Features
- Anonymity is removed
- Question quotas (prevent dumb questions)
- Run code on piazza 

- Written in secure C
- No annoying "notes" that bypass notification settings
- Professors upload grades onto our server (no need for gradescope)

- All posted code is plagariasm checked, reports sent to professor

- Pay people directly from piazza using my custom TLS implementation

- Cross post from Facebook groups

- Meme generator, using computer vision

    - Deep integration with UCBMFET and sounds eecs but ok

Also, should I make piazza free or paid? Thoughts on freemium model? I'll keep it cheap but developers ought to be compensated for their time.

OP here, I would like to hire people for my startup Piazza 2.0. I'm funded by Google Ventures, and I need all the help you can get. Anybody who has earned A+ grades in at least 5 upper-div cs courses and is in TBP and HKN is welcome to apply

@Yujie, @Steven Bi, other past TAs, please answer!

- Professors upload grades onto our server (no need for gradescope)

- All posted code is plagariasm checked and reports sent to professor

- Pay people directly from piazza using my own custom TLS implementation

Also, should I make piazza free or paid? Thoughts on freemium model? I'll keep it cheap but developers ought to be compensated for their time.
history.subject: [FEEDBACK] Re-implementing piazza

history.content:
I am re-building piazza from scratch. The project is trivial and it won't take longer than 24 hours. Afterwards, I'll convince all the professors to adopt my software. These connections will guarantee me an internship at Facebook or Google.

Please give me feedback and feature requests.

Features
- Anonymity is removed
- Improved search
- Question quotas for each user (prevent dumb questions)
- Run code on piazza (like iPython notebook)
- No annoying "notes" that bypass notification settings
- Professors upload grades on piazza (no need for gradescope)

- All posted code is plagariasm checked and reports sent to professor

- Pay people directly from piazza using my own custom TLS implementation

Also, should I make piazza free or paid? Thoughts on freemium model? I'll keep it cheap but developers ought to be compensated for their time.
